content: PROTECTION OF EMPLOYEES FROM RETALIATION BY EMPLOYER FOR COOPERATING IN INVESTIGATIONS: Oil Pollution Act of 1990 amended to include new section prohibiting retaliation. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 prohibits employers from retaliating against employees who report violations, refuse to participate in noncompliant activities, provide information to Congress or authorities, or are about to commence legal action. The Oil Pollution Act of 1990 prohibits employer retaliation against employees who report violations, refuse to participate in noncompliant activities, provide information to authorities, or are about to commence legal action. Employees covered by the Act can bring discrimination claims under specific procedures and seek district court review within 90 days of a final determination by the Secretary of Labor. Amendments to the Act clarify that any reference to the Act includes provisions of law enacted by the amendment.
